main event: A Naval Aviator observed a slightly oblong, solid mass with a soft incandescent outline moving horizontally across their field of vision in Fairfax, Virginia in 1952.
interesting points: The duration of the sighting was only 3-5 seconds, and the observer was at a dining room window while having dinner.
Local newspapers reported the object as a balloon.
The observer was in a poor position to make a detailed observation.
The source of the observation was considered reliable, being a Naval Aviator.
The conclusions of the observation were that it was a balloon.
sighted object: slightly oblong, solid mass with a soft incandescent outline
